quote: Censorship is the child of fear and the father of ignorance.
author: Laurie Halse Anderson,  Speak

quote: Censorship of anything, at any time, in any place, on whatever pretense, has always been and always will be the last resort of the boob and the bigot.
author: Eugene O'Neill

quote: Censorship is to art as lynching is to justice.
author: Henry Louis Gates

quote: Censoring books that deal with difficult, adolescent issues does not protect anybody. Quite the opposite. It leaves kids in the darkness and makes them vulnerable. Censorship is the child of fear and the father of ignorance. Our children cannot afford to have the truth of the world withheld from them
author: Laurie Halse Anderson

quote: Let children read whatever they want and then talk about it with them. If parents and kids can talk together, we won't have as much censorship because we won't have as much fear.
author: Judy Blume

quote: Censorship ends in logical completeness when nobody is allowed to read any books except the books that nobody can read."[As quoted in Literary Censorship in England (in Current Opinion, Vol. 55, No. 5, November 1913)]
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: A censor is an expert in cutting remarks. A censor is a man who knows more than he thinks you ought to.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: I also hold very strong personal convictions about censorship. I don't believe in forbidden knowledge.
author: Andrea Cremer,  Nightshade

quote: All the papers that matter live off their advertisements, and the advertisers exercise an indirect censorship over news.
author: George Orwell,  Why I Write

quote: I resent the fact that a parental warning sticker has to be included on an album as cover art. To me that's censorship.
author: Jeff Buckley

quote: Readers, censors know, are defined by the books they read.
author: Alberto Manguel,  The Library at Night

quote: Children deprived of words become school dropouts; dropouts deprived of hope behave delinquently. Amateur censors blame delinquency on reading immoral books and magazines, when in fact, the inability to read anything is the basic trouble.
author: Peter S. Jennison

quote: Libraries should be open to all - except the censor.[Response to questionnaire in Saturday Review, October 29 1960]
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: A performance art piece is unprecedented. It is difficult to censor since it has a good possibility of never being done before.
author: Jack Bowman

quote: People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: What cannot be said above all must not be silenced but written.
author: Jacques Derrida

quote: A doctrine of expression rather than one of suppression makes a stronger appeal to man.
author: Holly Estil Cunningham,  An Introduction to Philosophy

quote: Did you ever hear anyone say, 'That work had better be banned because I might read it and it might be very damaging to me'?
author: Joseph Henry Jackson

quote: Readers are bullied in schoolyards and in locker-rooms as much as in government offices and prisons.
author: Alberto Manguel,  A History of Reading

quote: EVERYTHING NOT FORBIDDEN IS COMPULSORY
author: T.H. White,  The Once and Future King

quote: People who practice freedom of expression are terrorizing our grammatical way of life.
author: Bauvard,  Some Inspiration for the Overenthusiastic

quote: If a believer demands that I, as a nonbeliever, observe his taboos in the public domain, he is not asking for my respect, but for my submission.
author: Flemming Rose

quote: [I]t's not just the books under fire now that worry me. It is the books that will never be written. The books that will never be read. And all due to the fear of censorship. As always, young readers will be the real losers.
author: Judy Blume

quote: I've tried to reduce profanity but I reduced so much profanity when writing the book that I'm afraid not much could come out. Perhaps we will have to consider it simply as a profane book and hope that the next book will be less profane or perhaps more sacred.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: To prohibit the reading of certain books is to declare the inhabitants to be either fools or slaves.
author: Claude Adrien Helvétius

quote: How do we account for this paradox that the absence of Law universalizes prohibition ... The psychoanalytic name for this obscene injunction for this obscene call, ENJOY, is superego. The problem today is not how to get rid of your inhibitions and to be able to spontaneously enjoy. The problem is how to get rid of this injunction to enjoy.
author: Slavoj Žižek

quote: The problem with today’s world is that everyone believes they have the right to express their opinion AND have others listen to it. The correct statement of individual rights is that everyone has the right to an opinion, but crucially, that opinion can be roundly ignored and even made fun of, particularly if it is demonstrably nonsense!
author: Brian Cox

quote: Silence is argument carried out by other means.
author: Ernesto Che Guevara

quote: Everything is permitted, Nothing is true.
author: Oliver Bowden,  Assassin's Creed: Renaissance

quote: Years of imprisoning and beheading writers never succeeded in shutting them out. However, placing them in the heart of a market and rewarding them with a lot of commercial success, has.
author: Arundhati Roy

quote: People cited violation of the First Amendment when a New Jersey schoolteacher asserted that evolution and the Big Bang are not scientific and that Noah's ark carried dinosaurs. This case is not about the need to separate church and state; it's about the need to separate ignorant, scientifically illiterate people from the ranks of teachers.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quote: I've been accused of vulgarity. I say that's bullshit.
author: Mel Brooks

quote: The hope of Internet anarchists was that repressive governments would have only two options: accept the Internet with its limitless possibilities of spreading information, or restrict Internet access to the ruling elite and turn your back on the 21st century, as North Korea has done.
author: Peter Singer

quote: Rule number one: Don't fuck with librarians.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: All words are masks and the lovelier they are, the more they are meant to conceal.
author: Steven Millhauser

quote: Writing is both mask and unveiling.
author: E.B. White

quote: Fair speech may hide a foul heart.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Two Towers

quote: If You Can't Think, You've No Right to Speak [10w] Our Constitution's guarantee of free speech specifically excludes fucking idiots.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: People worry about kids playing with guns, and teenagers watching violent videos; we are scared that some sort of culture of violence will take them over. Nobody worries about kids listening to thousands - literally thousands - of songs about broken hearts and rejection and pain and misery and loss.
author: Nick Hornby,  High Fidelity

quote: There is nothing more awful, insulting, and depressing than banality.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: As a teacher of fourth-graders in a public school, where corporal punishement was not allowed, she had years of violence stored up and was, truth be told, sort of enjoying letting it out on Kona, who she felt could have been the poster child for the failure of public education.
author: Christopher Moore,  Fluke: Or, I Know Why the Winged Whale Sings

quote: As the world fights those who use violence to advance their agenda, engagement, not neutrality,is needed in our educational systems.
author: Gregory S. Prince, Jr.,  Teach Them To Challenge Authority: Educating for healthy societies

quote: Controversy is part of the nature of art and creativity.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: Cautious, careful people, always casting about to preserve their reputation and social standing, never can bring about a reform. Those who are really in earnest must be willing to be anything or nothing in the world's estimation, and publicly and privately, in season and out, avow their sympathy with despised and persecuted ideas and their advocates, and bear the consequences...
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Humor comes in all forms, and everyone has their cup of tea about what makes them laugh. But the day we censor humor is a sad one for sure.
author: Marlee Matlin

quote: The nation that complacently and fearfully allows its artists and writers to become suspected rather than respected is no longer regarded as a nation possessed with humor or depth.
author: James Thurber

quote: The danger is that in reaction to abuses and distortions of an idea, we'll reject it completely. And in the process miss out on the good of it, the worth of it, the truth of it.
author: Rob Bell,  Sex God: Exploring the Endless Connections Between Sexuality and Spirituality

quote: There should be a law that no ordinary newspaper should be allowed to write about art. The harm they do by their foolish and random writing it would be impossible to overestimate - not to the artist, but to the public, blinding them to all but harming the artist not at all.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: When faith in our freedom gives way to fear of our freedom, silencing the minority view becomes the operative protocol.
author: Joel Salatin,  Everything I Want to Do Is Illegal: War Stories from the Local Food Front

quote: Allowing a handful of broadband carriers to determine what people see and do online would fundamentally undermine the features that have made the Internet such a success, and could permanently compromise the Internet as a platform for the free exchange of information, commerce, and ideas.
author: Vint Cerf
